title: forge debug does not support constructor args

body: It's telling you that it couldn't deploy the contract, so the revert is inside your constructor I would assume. Can you check that your constructor is sound and/or provide a code snippet?

`forge script` and `forge debug` do not support constructor args at the moment. Passing `--sig "constructor(...)"` will still try to deploy the contract with no arguments in the constructor, and then afterwards call a function matching `constructor(...)`. cc @joshieDo 

Edit: It's not entirely clear what you are trying to do here to me - what function are you trying to run?

You can pass arguments via the `run()` function, that's the whole purpose of it! `function run(address x)` and then `forge script <..args>`

closing as #wontfix

> You can pass arguments via the `run()` function, that's the whole purpose of it! `function run(address x)` and then `forge script <..args>`
> 
> closing as #wontfix

Is this documented anywhere? I can't find it on the foundry book nor `forge script --help`

Edit:
Found a helpful comment here: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/2229#issuecomment-1176892853
yeah it's done via `forge script MyScript --sig "run(address,uint256)"  <address> <uint256>`, @fmnxl do you mind opening an issue on the book to document it? or a PR?
